results.title: Removing or installing a compressor or condenser
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Common cooling unit disorders in a domestic refrigerator; how to evacuate valved evaporators; remove an oil-logged evaporator; install the evaporator; and install a direct expansion cooling unit.

results.title: Checking the system. Pt. II: trouble shooting
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install a gauge manifold in a domestic refrigerator; how to check abnormal head pressure and abnormal back pressure; how to determine causes of several common troubles such as “unit will not run”, “no refrigeration, but the unit runs continuously”, and “improper refrigeration of food but the unit freezes ice cubes”. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Checking the system. Pt. I: general procedure
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install gauges in a domestic refrigerator; check operating pressure, compressor performance, and temperature range of the cooling unit; and clean the condenser and oil the motor of an open-type refrigeration unit. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Checking and replacing a float valve
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates the function of two basic types of float valves - high-side float and low-side float; how to correct troubles in both types; and replace a high-side float. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Adjusting pressure actuated temperature control devices
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the purpose of pressure actuated temperature control devices; how to adjust the pressure actuated motor control and how to adjust the metering type and snap-action two-temperature valves.

results.title: The Devil's playground (1928)
results.creator_credit: Victor Bindley and Fineart Films Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
Somewhere in the South Seas, a beautiful island has become notorious for the “fetish and cannibal rites” of the natives and the “wild doings” of the white population. The native chief, Trelua, leads an insurrection against the whites because of the degradation that his people have suffered since the arrival of the whiteman. A British cruiser comes to the rescue and the native rebellion is quelled, but not before the main white oppressor is killed.
results.description:

results.title: The Enemy within
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
Snowy Baker, is a secret service agent called in to crack a ring of foreign agents involved in treason and civil violence in Australia. Jack’s sweetheart, Myee, is kidnapped by the villains, but after a long chase Jack is able to trap the enemy and rescue Myee.

group_siblings.title: The Devil's playground (1928)
group_siblings.creator_credit: Victor Bindley and Fineart Films Productions

results.title: The Cheaters
results.brief_description:
An embezzler, Bill Marsh, swears vengeance on a businessman, John Travers, who has turned him in to the police. Twenty years pass, and Marsh emerges from jail and establishes himself as the head of a powerful crime empire, with his daughter, Paula, serving as bait to attract wealthy victims. Paula falls in love with Lee Travers, the adopted son of Marsh’s old enemy, and begins to have doubts about her life of crime. Only after a series of tragic incidents is she set free to marry Lee and start life anew. This silent feature was highly regarded for its set design and ‘unusual sensitivity to the expressive range of the camera and their awareness of careful scenario construction as a key to emotionally powerful cinema’.
Cast includes Marie Lorraine, Arthur Greenaway, John Faulkner.
A sound version was attempted soon after but was not successful and was never released.

results.title: The Breaking of the drought
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
When the outback station of Wallaby is gripped by drought, the proud old owner, Jo Galloway, can do nothing to prevent the repossession of his land by the bank. In poverty, he moves to the city with his wife and daughter, to stay with his son Gilbert, only to learn that Gilbert has been embezzling the family funds to lead a life of luxury and decadence. Many melodramatic events follow, including a murder and a suicide, before the family can return, reunited, to the station, and the rain starts to fall once more.
